title: libert19
author: libert19
created_time: May 06, 2023, 07:53:05 AMLast edit: May 06, 2023, 09:06:25 AM by libert19
content: I saw several users requesting for this feature, there are plenty workarounds like using third party editors however this one takes the cake as it works on bitcointalk editor. Nothing extraordinary, just an extension, named TextArea Cache. Download it For Chrome | For Firefox.Automatically saves text written in editor, bitcointalk and others, even when window/tab is closed, system shutdown or pressed 'X' on your mobile keyboard (works with any extension supported browser). Android:  Kiwi  | Lemur |  Mises iOS: OrionLeave your feedback.

comments.author: ImThour
comments.body: That's a great extension I never realized I needed. Sometimes you literally want to close another window and you close the one with bitcointalk and you lose what you have been writing.I will surely install it. I wish if anything like this was also thought of by the SMF team.

comments.author: libert19
comments.body: Surprised, this didn't get as much as traction I expected it to, bump please!

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: I don't like to use those extensions because I prioritize my safety and security on my device first.Convenience is not my priority as I can manually do it with Notepad, Word and so on. No need to use extensions which can save my time but it is not too much to sacrifice safety and security. A few seconds to copy and paste to save a draft is not annoying with me.Browser extensions: more dangerous than you think

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: This is good but this not what we need. I hope someone had created similar topic like this before some times ago last year. But I can't cognitively remember the thread. The extension is good but there is no different from using other in-built text editors like notepad, wordpad etc. They are doing almost the same function. If the feature you are recommending is the first hand feature in the forum then it would have been a very nice welcoming recommendation. The forum text editor is good just that tool bars are not enough. Let all the tool bars for editing text should be added to the forum text editor then everything will be working fine. I also checked the links the op dropped the apps are nice to use but that will another extra work when typing copying. There are lot of extension, even Chrome, Firefox etc has it. We are not using it because it is not directly use in the forum. We need something that will be directly use in the forum without extension.

comments.author: skarais
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on May 07, 2023, 12:51:31 PMSurprised, this didn't get as much as traction I expected it to, bump please!I thought I didn't really need such an extension until now, even if it was fine in your case and some other users.I only tend to use a notepad or similar to save some of my writing if I'm create thread, but I guess I just rarely do it unless it takes me a few days to finish a single thread. So, MS Word and Notepad are two applications that I often use to store text.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: Good one, I love this tools. I think those who love autosave text will surely use this tools on their system since they have been expecting Theymos to implement something like this., My question is how secure is this extension?  Because the easiest way to get phished is through extension to have remote control over your browser this includes monitoring the kind of site we visit and also extracting our password.

comments.body: Don't be surprised if the extension doesn't meet your expectations. Are you part of the developer of the extension?Most users today are still more comfortable using the Text editor when and of course with the same autosave. comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on May 06, 2023, 07:53:05 AMAndroid:  Kiwi  | Lemur |  MisesWell, that's a great feature but i think not for those who use BTT on Android's Google Chrome, as you have already mentioned some browsers but most of the people like me google chrome and i have lost data many times as while typing i have to click on back button to close the keyboard but sometimes i didn't realize i clicked two times and i come back to previous tab without saving it and it all frustrate me, but i think we could use Kiwi as it has some reputation and at least it will save the time. And thanks for sharing the extension. But many members on this forum prefer to think about security and they are highly sticking to the rule of fewer extensions means less malware. As most of the extension must need the permission of each keystroke so that they could save your data on it, and i hope you got my point like when you hit keystroke for entering a password for any web-based wallet or entering any other important password each keystroke will be saved and thus that extension could scam you.So, for now, it would be great if someone from the forum could make one, as a member made image hosting platform (talkimg).
